content.desc: Alexander J. Urbelis is a lawyer and self-described hacker with more than 20 years' experience with information security. He has worked as a graduate fellow in the Office of General Counsel of the Central Intelligence Agency, as a law clerk at the US Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces and as an associate in the New York and Washington offices of Steptoe & Johnson. He was also information security counsel and chief compliance officer of one of the world's largest luxury conglomerates. He is currently a partner in the Blackstone Law Group and CEO of a separate information security consulta...

content.title: Facebookは奇妙な新アンチ・セックス音声コードを秘密裏に採用 -  RT
content.desc: Facebook has opted to purge its platform of all sex-related content with a new policy banning everything from nude pictures to “sexualized slang,” up to and including “vague suggestive statements” – without informing its users. The new “sexual solicitation” rules were adopted in mid-October, according to PCMag, and forbid everything from pornography to “implicit sexual solicitation.” The latter term is purposefully vague, encompassing “vague suggestive statements, such as ‘looking for a good time tonight,’” discussion of “sexual partner preference,” content (including hand-drawn art) that d...

content.title: Facebookのダーク・デイズ、そしてライト・アヘッド - フォーブス
content.desc: The Facebook Inc. application on an Apple Inc. iPhone. Photographer: Andrew Harrer/Bloomberg Facebook just suffered the ugliest few weeks in its history, and I’m not talking about its shares plunging over 40% in the last four months. The company allegedly sold user data to businesses in secret deals, according to emails and internal documents released this week by U.K. lawmakers. Facebook has for years been collecting Android phone data — dates, times, call lengths, call recipients, phone numbers and text messages — even when people weren’t using its app, and it sold the personal data of ov...

content.title: Instagram best nine 2018：今年のトップ写真を見つけてコラージュを共有する方法 -  The Independent
content.desc: As the year draws to a close, people are rushing to make their Instagram best nine and find their most popular pictures of the year. The annual collage has become something of a tradition, allowing people to reflect on the posts that were liked most by their friends throughout the year. In 2018, there are a whole range of tools that make it very easy. Instagram doesn't offer the feature, however. Thankfully, you don't have to pick through all your pictures and find out the best ones: there's plenty of websites available to do that for you. The best one appears to be topnine.co, which includ...

content.title: 米国のファンドマネージャーがFacebookを利用して代替案を探す - ロイター
content.desc: Facebook Inc's (FB.O: Quote, Profile, Research, Stock Buzz) losses are becoming other companies' gains. Concerns about the social media giant's declining profit margins and battered reputation have prompted 93 U.S. mutual funds to completely sell out of their positions in the company so far this year, exacerbating a roughly 35 percent decline in Facebook's share price from its highs, according to Refinitiv’s Lipper research service. The selling by fund firms including Fidelity Investments, The Hartford and Putnam Investments combined for a total of nearly 12 million shares, and came amid si...

content.desc: LOVE & MONEY By Quentin Fottrell Couples who meet online through any site are more likely to be interracial than those who met off-line Meeting online is associated with greater racial diversity than the ‘real’ world. Picturehouse/Courtesy Everett Collection This is the time of year when people sign up to dating sites in the hope they don’t see in the New Year alone, and they’re looking beyond their own social bubbles for love. Does online dating break down barriers? Research suggests it does. Dating sites bring people from different backgrounds together in a way that other parts of the...

content.title: Facebookは数百人のユーザーのために米国東海岸でダウンしています -  RT
content.desc: Social media behemoth Facebook appears to be suffering from technical difficulties, with hundreds of users reporting the site down across the US Eastern seaboard. Reports flooded into Downdetector.com - a site where users can check up on and report outages - on Friday morning. Almost half of the reports were login issues, while another third reported the social network totally down. The remainder of the reports concerned Facebook’s mobile apps. © Downdetector Late last month, both Facebook and Instagram were hit with major worldwide outages, and Facebook’s Messenger app crashed for hundred...
